title: Drawing, "Design No. 3 for an Ark Curtain", 1950
medium: Brush and gouache, watercolor, gold and silver paint on brown paper
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower right corner:  T.G.
inscribed:
Imprinted label affixed to lower right corner of mat:  Pond Farm Workshop (upper right); Trude Guermonprez Textile Design/Guerneville California (upper left)
Typed on label: Design No. 3/A silk dubble [sic] weave in tones of blue and purple./The kandelabras [sic] are thin sheet metal shapes inser-/ted into the fabric. The letters of the word ["word" is crossed out]/Israel and tapestry - inlay w [overtyped with "i"] th goldthread [sic] black/and colored silk./ For this curtain are planned four pannels [sic], 36" wide.  Many, but/shallow folds will bring out the shiny and the saturated shades of/silk in light and shadow.  The letters of the word Israel are so big,/that some movement of the fabric will not interfere with their legi-/bility./ $1185.60 (under text at left); T.G. (under text at right).
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Curtain decorated with rows of gold menorahs to be made of sheet metal on blue and purple woven  backgound.  Inscribed in large gold Hebrew letters across middle:  Yisrael [Israel].
